question: Which statement aligns closest to your view on what the solution should be for illegal immigration?

answers.text: A relentless, continual process of permanently removing illegal migrants to Rwanda with a regular rhythm of flights every month.
Stop the chaos and go after the criminal gangs who trade in driving this crisis. New Enforcement unit to fast-track removals to safe countries for people without right to stay here
Scrap the Rwanda scheme and urge the UK Government to grant asylum seekers the right to work and fundamentally change their approach to housing asylum seekers.
Scrap the Illegal Migration Act and the Rwanda scheme and provide safe and legal routes to sanctuary for refugees.
Leave the European Convention on Human Rights. Zero illegal immigrants to be resettled in the UK. New Department of Immigration. Pick up illegal migrants out of boats and take them back to France.

question: What parties statement about their plans for the military is the most appealing?

answers.text: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of National GDP by year 3, then 3% within 6 years. Increase basic pay across our armed forces
2.5% of GDP spent on defence by 2030. Support our Trident nuclear deterrent and modernise it. Launch a campaign to set a new baseline of 2.5% for all NATO allies by 2030.
Commited to the UKs nuclear deterrent. Conduct a Strategic Defence Review within our first year in government. Set out the path to spending 2.5% of GDP on defence. Meet all Nato Obligations
Scrap Trident nuclear deterrent and invest the billions spent instead in public services. Raise the military recruitment age to 18.
Get rid of the nuclear weapons we have. The UK to sign the treaty stopping nuclear weapons and get others to stop having them as well.

Ambition to spend at least 2.5% of GDP on defence. Maintaining the UKs nuclear deterrent with four submarines whilst pursuing multilateral global disarmament. Ambition of getting regular troop numbers to over 100,000.

question: What statment aligns most with your opinions on the conflict in Palestine / Israel?

answers.text: Push for Immediate Ceasefire. Call for release of hostages. Recognizing a Palestinian State and a two state solution.
Demand Ceasefire and release of hostages. End all arms sales to Israel. Recognise Palestine as Independant state.
Stand behind Israels right to defend itself. Push for two state solution. Support aid for those affected by conflict.
Push for an end to the fighting. Stop selling arms to Israel. Make Israel give Palestinian land back. Give UN aid organisation money again.
Advocate for immediate ceasefire. Get the hostages out and provide space to reach a two-state solution.

question: What statement aligns with your opinions on the future of transport in the UK?

answers.text: Public ownership of rail services. establish a new Low Income EV Car Leasing Fund. Fulfil the commitment to fund improvements to the A75.
Save £25 Billion by scrapping rest of HS2 project. Ban ULEZ Clean Air Zones. Extend rail and bus services in the Midlands, Wales and Coastal regions.

Spend £36 billion of HS2 savings on other transport projects. £44 billion of funding for Network Rail and the Transpennine Route Upgrade to introduce Northern Powerhouse Rail. Complete HS2 between London Euston and the West Midlands.
Cheaper public transport. More bus and train services. Free bus travel for anyone under 18. New cyclepaths and footpaths.
Postpone the A27 bypass. Help with the rising cost of insurance. Bring railways into public ownership again under Great British Railways.

Make it cheaper to swap to Electric cars. Freeze rail fares prices. Electrify more of the rail network and deliver Northern Powerhouse rail. Reduce number of flights. New cycling and walking networks.

question: What statement aligns the most with your idea of how to help the education sector?

answers.text: Qualified mental health professional in every primary and secondary school. Increase school and college funding per pupil.
Spend more money on Schools. Pay Teachers more. Stop Tuition fees. stop testing as it doesn’t do anygood, and scrap OFSTED.

Scrap Interest on Student Loans. Universities must offer 2 year undergrad courses. Teaching British or Eurpean Imperialism must be paired with a non-European occurence for balance. Ban Transgender Ideology in schools. Tax relief of 20% on private schools.
Free University Tuition.
Ban mobile Phones in school. Have transparency in teaching content related to sex education. Fund 100,000 Apprenticeships. Curb number of poor-quality university degrees.
Recruit 6500 new expert teachers. Free breakfast clubs in all primary schools. 3000 new school-based nurseries. New 20% VAT on private school fees to fund public schools.

question: What statement aligns the most with your beliefs on LGBT+ issues.

answers.text: Make all LGBT+ hatecrimes an aggravated offence. Ban on conversion therapy. Reform gender recognition laws.
Defend the rights of all sexual orientations. Ban conversion therapy. Give police and prosecutors training to prevent and prosecute hatecrimes.
Take a stand against hatecrimes. Allow trans and non-binary people to say who they are.
Ban transgender ideology in schools.

question: What statement aligns with your views of the future of policing in the UK?

answers.text: Scrap laws which stop people's right to protest. Help the public trust the police more. Pay for new courts.
Recruit 8000 more full-time police officers. Hotspot policing to cut anti-social behaviour in town centres.

Recruit thousands of officers. Holding companies and executives profiting on knife crime to account. Visible neighbourhood policing. Introducing Respect Orders: powers to ban persistent adult offenders from town centres
40 000 new front-line officers. Increase stop and search substantially. Prison for possessing a knife. Scrap all Diversity Equity and Inclusion roles. Stricter entry requirements.
Restore proper community policing. Create guarantee that all burglaries will be attended by police. Tackle repeat offenders by improving rehabilitation.

question: What statement aligns with your beliefs on Britains role in helping deal with the climate crises.

answers.text: Have new laws giving nature its own rights. Stop sewage in our rivers and seas. New law to make the air cleaner.
Preserve the Green Belt. Tackle the nature emergency including the pollution of rivers and seas. We will make sure the country meets collective obligations to future generations.
Protect the Green Belt from uncontrolled development. Launch seaside heritage fund to protect coastal assets. Protect the blue belt. Stopping deep sea mining.
End the sewage scandal banning bonuses for water bosses. Double the size of the protected wildlife area network by 2050. Plant 60 million trees a year. Enfore a new air quality agency.
Establish a four nations climate response group to agree climate plans across the UK. Ease animal exports to and from the EU.
Ditch Net Zero saving £30 Billion a year.

question: What statement aligns with your vision of the UK's energy sector.

answers.text: Scrap £10 Billion of renewable subsidies. Fast track licences of North Sea gas and oil. Fast track nuclear energy with small modular reactors. Scrap all Net Zero pledges saving £30 Billion per year.

Committed to Net Zero by 2050. Annual licensing rounds for oil and gas production in the North Sea. New Gas Power stations to prevent blackouts. Treble our offshore wind capacity. Build first two carbon capture storage clusters.
Most of our energy must come from wind by 2030. More solar power plants. More battery storage sites. Stop all drilling for oil and gas. Shut down nuclear power plants.
Invest in renewables until 90% of UK's power is from renewables. Drive a rooftop solar revolution. Free insulation for those on low-income.
Double onshore wind, Quadruple offshore wind and Triple solar power. Create a new publicly owned company, Great British Energy to deliver clean power by co-investing in leading tech.
Rule out new nuclear power plants. Promote hydrogen export potential. Evidance based approach to new oil and gas licences. Need signifigant growth in renewables, storage, hydrogen and carbon capture.

question: How should Britian contribute to foreign countries in need?

answers.text: Immediately restore and maintain the UK international aid budget to 0.7%.
Cut Foreign aid by 50% saving £6 Bilion. Review effectiveness of foreign aid.
Contribute more aid to developing countries to go green and more aid to the new Loss and Damage fund.
By returning spending to 0.7% of national income and re-establishing an independent international development department

question: What statement aligns with your view of future taxes in the UK?

answers.text: Lift the income tax to start at £20 000. Cut Energy Taxes. Scrap VAT on energy bills. Cut stamp duty on houses under 750k to 0%. Abolish Inheritance tax for estate under £2 Million.
Cut 2p off National Insurance saving the average worker £1350. Cut tax for pensioners.
Tax the rich more and make sure average earners are taxed fairly.
Reversing the tax cuts for big banks and imposing a one-off windfall tax on the super-profits of oil and gas.
Not increase taxes on working people.We will end the use of offshore trusts to avoid inheritance tax.

question: What statement aligns with economic changes you think will benefit the UK the most?

answers.text: Introduced the biggest business tax cut in modern British history. Improve access to finance for SMEs. Secure a £250 million Invest In Women Fund.
Establish a National Wealth Fund making transformative investments in the the automative, steel and green hydrogen industries. Cap corporation tax at the current level of 25 per cent.

Abolish Business rates for high street stores offset this with Online Delivery Tax at 4% for large enterprises. Lift the VAT Threshold to £150,000. Lift the minimum profit threshold to £100k for corporation tax.
Abolishing business rates and replacing them with a Commercial Landowner Levy.
Introduce a lower rate of VAT for hospitality and tourism. Remove VAT from on-street electric vehicle charging. End the VAT exemption for private schools.

question: What statement aligns with your view of the path to fixing the NHS's doctor and nurse shortages?

answers.text: Frontline NHS and social care staff to pay zero basic rate tax. Write off student fees pro rata per year over 10 years of NHS service for all doctors, nurses and medical staff.
We will pay NHS staff more.
Recruit 8500 more mental health staff. Create a National Care Service, underpinned by national standards, delivering consistency of care across the country.
8,000 more GPs.
92,000 more nurses and 28,000 more doctors. Bring in more workers from abroad.

question: What statement aligns with your views of the path forward for the NHS.

answers.text: Same day GP services available to all. NHS dentistry for all easy availible.
Invest £300m to drive down waiting times. Boost NHS spending by a minimum of £10bn extra each year.
NHS Patients will receive a voucher for free private treatment if they can’t see a GP within 3 days. For a consultant it would be 3 weeks. For an operation, 9 weeks.
Increase NHS spending above inflation every year. deliver 40 new hospitals by 2030. Patient premium to encourage dentists to take on new NHS patients. Build or modernise 250 GP surgeries.

Double the number of CT and MRI scanners. Guarantee a face-to-face GP appointment for all those who want one. reform the dental contract, with a shift to focusing on prevention and the retention of NHS dentists
